data.Sentence: --- Lesson 11  One good turn deserves another

data.Sentence_cn: 我正在一家饭馆吃饭，托尼.斯蒂尔走了进来。
data.Sentence: I was having dinner at a restaurant when Tony Steele came in.

data.Sentence_cn: 托尼曾在一家律师事务所工作，而现在正在一家银行上班。
data.Sentence: Tony worked in a lawyer's office years ago, but he is now working at a bank.

data.Sentence_cn: 他的薪水很高，但他却总是向朋友借钱，并且从来不还。
data.Sentence: He gets a good salary, but he always borrows money from his friends and never pays it back.

data.Sentence_cn: 托尼看见了我，就走过来和我坐到一张桌子前。
data.Sentence: Tony saw me and came and sat at the same table.
He has never borrowed money from me.

data.Sentence_cn: 当他吃饭时，我提出向他借20英镑。
data.Sentence: While he was eating, I asked him to lend me twenty pounds.

data.Sentence_cn: 令我惊奇的是，他立刻把钱给了我。
data.Sentence: To my surprise, he gave me the money immediately.

data.Sentence_cn: “我还从未向你借过钱，”托尼说道，“所以现在你可以替我付饭钱了！”
data.Sentence: 'I have never borrowed any money from you,' Tony said, 'so now you can pay for my dinner!'
